main event: A sighting of a blue-white luminous 'V' formation of seven objects observed in Silver Springs, Maryland, on 5 August 1957.
interesting points: The total sighting duration was 4 minutes and 30 seconds,The objects were estimated to be at an altitude of 100,000 feet, moving at a speed of 1200 mph,The size of each object was compared to the head of a pin, while the whole formation was three times the size of the moon,The sighting was made by a couple who called neighbors to witness, one of whom used binoculars for a clearer view,The source of the observation was deemed unreliable due to extreme estimates of altitude and speed.
sighted object: seven blue-white luminous objects in a 'V' formation
